Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: VCharlotte1
Reviews.Content: In a great location just off La Rambla we could see the busy square and watch the buskers from our balcony. The service was average but our room was clean and was cleaned. The breakfast was very simple, pastries and hot beverages however it was obvious that they made a big batch of the croissants etc. at the start of the week rather that daily so they were horrible by day 3. The restaurant tapas was very nice- not exceptional- but good none the less and the paella was made to order (as you'd expect) and good too. Nb. some great helado/ ice-cream places round the corner. Pretty good value but worth while for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LesleyAnneClark
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Low Cost Holidays and found it an excellent place. The rooms are basic but kept clean and tidy daily with change of towels and sheets. Its in a superb location just off the Rambla set in a beautiful square which used to be a convent with cloisters all round and great restaurants.The staff in the hotel are extremely nice kind and helpful and as I am disabled they went out of their way to meet all my needs. I will definately go back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “it really is a 1 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rishi C
Reviews.Content: Overall, I did not enjoy staying at this hotel. It does what it says on the tin- 1 star! The hotel is in a nice part of the Rambla, in a beautiful square surrounded by bars and restaurants. The location is very good and popular with student groups. The room was ok, very basic but clean. The towels would get changed everyday. Our room was towards the back of the hotel and we had a dreadful view. Whereas, if you are facing the square you get sunshine in your room and a nice view. Breakfast was a bread roll and jam!! The staff were very quiet but friendly. The lift is very wierd & quite scary! Would not recommend unless you just need somewhere to literally sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location! and that's it!”
Reviews.Author: NadiaSoraiaSantos
Reviews.Content: It's a hotel with a great location, at the Ramblas, near all restaurants and nightlife, BUT that's it! I went to a bachelorette party, with a group of friends, and it was good, cause we were near the centre and in 3 days we could visit a lot of the city. The hotel it's ok, the room it's not very well equipped and the cleaning is bad! The breakfast is bad, either. it's very cheap and it works for sleep and go, but not more than that!

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you have to”
Reviews.Author: Margaret H
Reviews.Content: Central location excellent. Although everyone was very friendly and helpful, the accommodation was not good. We were at the very top (dreadful lift) at the back with a window that would not open and no aircon. The view I guess was too bad to let anyone see. The bathroom smelt and the whole feeling of the hotel was very very basic. We arrived from Greece late (chaos on the railways) and so were too exhausted to change our room. Beware of being there on a Sunday evening when there are long queues at every restaurant in the square everyone waiting to eat

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Rit003
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very central place. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room we stayed in had a balcony so I guess we were more lucky than others. The balcony overlooked Placa Real which was very nice. The room was a bit small but we expected it to be that way. What we didn't expect was that in the room there was only 1 plug and another in the bathroom. We stayed at the hotel in August and it was hot so the fan was always on, so that only left 1 plug for us to use! But on the whole it was value for money!

Reviews.Title: “awful!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tassos09
Reviews.Content: Not recommended to ANYONE!!! except school students... very noisy, no way to sleep during the night... drugs, many hookers at the plaza in front of the hotel, lots of good guys looking forward to stealing anything they can, many tourists vomiting all over the plaza... Really awful the surroundings.. And now we come to the nicest part: the hotel... the elevator really old!!!! a miracle if you don't stuck in there... the room where we stayed was too SMALL (I' ve been to various hotels, nothing similar to this suck), there was no balcony, only a small window... there were only two plugs (one of them in the bathroom!!!!) in one word: REALLY SUCKS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It provides what it says on the the brochure”
Reviews.Author: Mac_the_KnifeKinsale
Reviews.Content: Cheap, clean, friendly staff, great location, reasonable breakfast - it has it all. Stayed for one night at weekend and am heading back to stay again. Had no problems with noise at night thought there were crowds outside in the square until the small hours of the morning. It still is a 1 star hotel so don't expect 3 star facilities - it is more like a hostel, but a very good one at that. No hesitation recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for nature of my trip”
Reviews.Author: LebowskiJag Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I was over for the Primavera Festival and chose the hotel based on its central location, price and the fact I knew the area well from previous visits. Hotel is basic, but clean, comfortable and did me fine. Perhaps if you are going to spend more time in it than I did or you want my luxury then this is not for you, however for the nature of my stay (I.e. a place to crash after attending festival to 4am each night, it was ideal and very reasonably priced given you are 20 seconds walk from La Rambla, various metro stations and loads of lovely restuarants in the actual sqaure itself.

Reviews.Title: “Banter”
Reviews.Author: BigJ0hn123
Reviews.Content: Top draw hotel, girls everywhere (even if they are shemale), alochol snuck into the hotel easily, narcotics easy to find, lovely man in the pub round the corner (gets very lonely), GREAT LOCATION, essex girls live near by. Beware of foreigners sharing the hotel (especially dutch). The louder you are the quieter everyone else is. Expect sleepless nights. Hookers nearby 20 euro a BJ - BARGAIN! Friendly staff but they get aggy early hours in the morning. Banging OJ. Perfect balcony. Lift was dodgey and did colapse with an elderly lady left with a broken leg. This hotel is TOP DRAW!

Reviews.Title: “good ,clean,basic hotel . staff helpful , food good wat more do you want for the price”
Reviews.Author: mandyann
Reviews.Content: i went on a sight seeing trip with my friend all we wanted was some where to sleep fantastic location , a bit noisy , but hey your on holiday , not for the upper class , i would stay there again but maybe not in the height of summer because no air con . and go to the reteraunt inthe square that people are always queing ia it is brill lovley food, hope this review helps , ho and please watch your handbags pick pockets not so good .

Reviews.Title: “Take your ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: CaroleRDurhamEngland Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a excellent location,very central and easy to locate.The rooms although dated were spotlessly clean,fresh linen daily.All hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Although the bathroom was priarily to take a shower there was a half size bath to take the weight off your feet...................lovely.............. Continental breakfast was more than sufficient,we ate at the hotel one lunchtime and the tapas were excelent. There was no noise from outside the hotel,however the coridors echoed.This would not stop me staying at the hotel again .Excellent service and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews! Great hotel - AMAZING LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: mm6460
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a school trip for 5 days. I'll be straight to the point: no, it doesn't have luxury kingsize beds and no, there's no room service - but you don't NEED them! Barcelona is an amazing city - beautiful architecture, vibe and nightlife. We simply used the hotel to sleep/wash in. The rooms were standard & comfy. There was a flat screen TV in the room, but we didn't once use it! The hotel staff were very friendly (they run pub crawls in the evening!) and the breakfast was good! The orange juice amazing. Don't waste a lot of money on an amazing hotel when you've got everything thats amazing outside! Enjoy Barcelona, as it is literally on your doorstep in this amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely cheap and simple hotel - would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: EstherBeth
Reviews.Content: Reading through the negative reviews, some people seem to have forgotten that this is a cheap, 1 star hotel. If you can afford luxury, of course stay somewhere better, but we were on a budget and this place was perfect for us. We arrived late at night and were dropped off at the far end of La Rambla - we had no idea where to go, but the hotel was only a ten minute walk and we found it easily enough. The hotel is situated on a busy square, and the hotel itself runs a 'club' in the basement (transformed in time for breakfast!) Despite this we never heard any noise in our room, and being two females, we quite liked knowing there was lots of activity happening outside, as it made us feel safe. So - location was perfect. We walked to everywhere we wanted to visit within the centre, and there was a metro station five minutes from the hotel for trips further afield. The room was basic but clean. Nothing fantastic - the bathroom and TV were small, and the corridors definitely needed some love. Reception was 24 hours, and very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was basic (croissants, jam) but there was lots of it. Everything was very basic, but they did 'basic' well. The hotel ran evening 'bar crawls' for the under 30s, and I probably wouldn't stay here if travelling with family, but saying this we did see a few families at breakfast. The lift seemed small, and I'm not sure how you would cope with a buggy and luggage. Overall, with its cheap price, friendly staff, and central location, I would say this is a perfect hotel for budget travellers. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Rockfairy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the worst hotel I have ever seen let alone stayed.It is situated in Placa Reial ,a traditional square ,only five minutes from Placa Catalunya (centre),and only two minutes from La Rambla,a central avenue with souvenir shops ,cafeterias,fast food restaurants etc.It is also close to pedestrian alleys that lead to various sites ,such as The Cathedral , Picasso Museum and Palais de Guell. Do not be misled by its convenient location however.Across La Rambla there were numerous 3 or 4 star hotels in reasonable prices,not much higher that what we paid for Reial Hotel. To begin with,the building was old,the elevator tiny and at the reception desk ,there was an unpleasant smell (fish or smth).The room we were given was terrible and judging by its appearance ,I assume all the rooms were terrible.The bathroom was acceptable and seemed "clean" but the room had the basics.4 beds(although we were 3 ) ,a side table, a mirror ... that's it.The walls were dirty and I believe they last painted them in the 90's.There were pipes on the wall,and the glass window was full of prints and had not be cleaned for ages. The service of the hotel was awful.At some point we asked for a glass(there was none in the room) and the answer was "tommorow!".Also,there was only one socket in the room high on the wall,and i could not use my hairdryer.The breakfast was basic (coffee,juice,muffins,croisssants).Last but not least ,you could hear anything from the next room.One morning someone was crying,and we could hear her clearly in our room!!It was pretty much an awful experience and it's a shame since Barcelona is so so so beautiful. Finally,I found completely hypocritic the fact that the restaurant /bar of the hotel(situated next to the hotel) was nice.I could even describe it as a trendy place to have a drink.The bar was admittedly very good ,decorated nicely.So it was like they did not care about the hotel but cared a lot about the resaurant because their costumers were not only the guests of the hotel. To sum up,if you want a decent place to stay ,you will regret choosing this hotel.If you don't really care about where you stay ,even if the place is disgusting then go.Don't forget that in La Rambla there are a LOT of nice and average priced hotels.This was not a good value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and an average hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RachShanHopeScarl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Roma reial Hotel for three nights and really enjoyed the experience. the staff were welcoming and helpful without being over friendly. The safes were useful to store valuables and the rooms themselves were average. Our room was very small but suited our needs, same with the bathroom. New towels were arranged each day however we were disappointed to find no clean bed sheets during our stay. the room was fairly clean but noise from nearby rooms made the nights uncomfortable. The breakfast wasn't good.And the lack of air con made the rooms constantly hot (however the hotel provided fans but it wasn't enough) the location was fantastic as it just off las ramblas and close to the food market. And it helped that the weather was great most of the time. one warning though - be careful with valuables/bag etc as a member of our group had some euros stolen on the metro. Overall you get what you pay for. Nothing special but the location makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: connie059
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for at this hotel,the location is perfect and the service is good. We were there in July and there was no air conditioning in our room which was a twin with two extra beds making it a bit cramped. Also our room overlooked the square (very nice) and the noise went on all night, we could'nt close our window because it was too hot. I would use this hotel again but not for a week as we did this time and maybe not in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GrVicky
Reviews.Content: We trevelled to Barcelona in mid September 2007 with my 2 friends. We picked this hotel because of the central location. We had the worst impression. On the first day at reception we waited 1 hour until we check in to because they had not emptied the room. The room smelled like awful. The smells coming from the kitchen of the Hotel were intolerable. They never cleaned the room. Breakfast very poor. Barcelona is a wonderful town, Roma Reial the worst hotel I have ever been

Reviews.Title: “Why did I not read the reviews?”
Reviews.Author: Nitel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week end in Barcelona. We wanted a hotel base and this sounded fine, basic , good value and central. On arrival the reception staff were non committal, we had to carry our luggage up the stairs as the lift did not stop at our floor. The room was clean and basic, but the smell of fish and cooking was a little overpowering. It was also very stuffy as the air conditioning was broken. When we reported this we were just told it was broken. The bathrooom was an issue. three people sharing a room you would expect a bath towel each, but no, only two, no bath mat -resulting in wet slippery floors, and no plugs in either basin or bath. Next day we asked for more towels at 20.00 and were told none available till 21.30. Non arrived. Breakfast- advertised as a buffet- but only bread and jam, coffee and cornflakes. no cheese , no meats, and only plastic cutlery.The staff were rude and unhelpful and you were asked to leave as soon as it got to 10.00. As a diabetic this meant i had a dry bread roll and a yoghurt every morning- oh joy! Sleep- not alot due to other peoples noise and commings and goings. Would we go again, Barcelona -yes, this hotel NO.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you like to court a little bit of danger!”
Reviews.Author: KaiserNewark
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have stated it's a great location just in the corner of a lovely place and off the main Ramblas. Receptionist(s) were courteous and efficient without being super friendly. The room was basic (£30 per night for a triple room) but was clean as was the bathroom. The shower wasn't brilliant but did the job well enough. I can't recall much noise, but then I had been drinking a lot so I guess I just crashed out. However, just round the corner you enter a nether world of scammers, pimps, prostitutes (with seriously aggressive marketing tactics involving grabbing your crutch!), drug dealers and various other ne're-do-well's and vagabonds lurking on the alley corners. If you are on your own or female stay well way. Breakfast was poor, just old buns and croissants with jam. Needes some cheeses and salami to perk it up a bit. Having said that we were fine and enjoyed the proximity to Barceloneta harbour. I'd probably stay another time, but only with mates who are well seasoned travellers again.

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant stay - stay here only if you hate sleep”
Reviews.Author: Brett1977
Reviews.Content: Right from arrival to departure was I disappointed with my stay at the Roma Reial hotel. I am not sensationalising when I say that the male receptionist checking me in remained on a personal call on his cell phone for the whole time I stood in front of the desk. He only took a break to hand me my room card. I had read other reviews of this hotel, and was slightly worried about actually getting sleep during the night. I am well travelled, and am not exaggerating when I say this was the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in. While I can deal with the odd door slamming, or late night arrivals, some youthful guests had taken it to the next level. On my third night, it got to 3am and I had not got to sleep because of these other guests running up and down the steps and knocking on each other’s doors. I even called reception, and advised them in my best and most respectful Catalan of the noise, but the guys hung up on me twice. I confronted reception in the morning of this, but I was simply advised that they are a 24 hour hotel and it is not possible to prevent this happening! What makes matters worse in this hotel are the tiled floors, which allowed high heels on the first floor to be easily heard in my fourth floor room. The room itself was definitely 1 star standard, and I have no complaints about that – it was as expected usual European size, the bed sheets were clean, and the bathroom acceptable. Breakfast was served from 8-10am and consisted of pastries, cheap cereal, coffee, tea and long life yoghurts. While the location was perfect, on Placa Reial and right off Las Ramblas, I was simply a walking zombie for my 4 day stay in Barcelona. I was really disappointed with this hotel, and it was purely down to not being allowed by the other guests a good night sleep. To sum up, I have stayed in much better hostels than this – until the staff actually start respecting their guests and treating them as paying customers, please consider staying elsewhere. Only will a lack of customers make this place change.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin but don't expect peace and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: blonderunner
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with 32 he students. The position of the hotel is fantastic and the rooms were clean and well serviced. Beds were made every day and the room prevented from becoming a tip! The walls of the rooms are, however, very thin and the noise from guests in adjoining rooms and tottering down marble corridors in stilettos at 4am can be overwhelming. I went prepared and took earplugs with me and by and large managed to get some sleep. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Get Away Not So Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: j-renee-vc
Reviews.Content: Had a four night break in Barcelona with the girls it was the best time in ages the hotel was very basic but the price and location made up for it. As we paid next to nothing for the whole trip we werent expecting anything fancy when we arrived I was suprised the reception was clean and tidy however the seating area was rather tatty, and the gentleman on reception was not particularly friendly. Our room was clean and tidy and had towells changed daily it was also spacious there were four of us sharing a room and we didnt get on top of each other. On our last night the toilet in our room broke management were very good about it and moved right away to another room. During our stay other guests were complaining about the accomidation and cockraches were found in their rooms I think it's important to stress that we didn't have this issue in our room but hearing about did make feel uneasy and question the hotel. The biggest dissapointment was the food we booked bed and breakfast but were dissapointed to discover breakfast was dry and hard pastries yogurts and hot and cold drinks. we were really expecting more variety some hot food would have been nice. I think the best part of the holday was the company and being in Barcelona as it's an amazing city. If your after 4* luxury then the Roma Reial is not the place for you but if what you want is a cheap place stay in a great location in the heart of the ramblas then book your barcelona break now, remember you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat the location of this simple but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelAuntieAlberta
Reviews.Content: We had a few days in Barcelona before embarking on a cruise, and we chose the Roma Reial for its location in the Placa Reial. We weren't expecting anything fancy, so weren't disappointed. The room was small, with two single beds, but it was clean and the shower was large. The elevator could win a world's smallest elevator contest, but it worked. We were delighted to find the hotel had an evening sidewalk cafe with a good menu and heat lamps, and there were plenty of other places to eat right in the same lovely palm-treed square. We were very close to the excitement of Las Ramblas, and within an easy walk of the market, the cathedral, the Columbus statue, the waterfront, and the Bus Turistic. Sure, things got a bit noisy at times -- soccer fans singing in the bar downstairs while I was napping -- but it was happy noise. The beautiful cathedral bells were a bonus. I would recommend the Roma Reial to anyone who can accept minimalist accommodation in exchange for a great location. We would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Very very warm, no air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: ilovedisneyBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in August, no air conditioning, room at bottom of shaft outside, so air was limited, we did have a fan but it wasnt enough. Very central and picturesque location though and the hotel was very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about position”
Reviews.Author: travelingmacs
Reviews.Content: This is a one star hotel so don't expect the ritz but the position is fantastic. overlooking the plaza real and 50metres off the ramblas as we said position position position. the hotel is also surrounded by great restaurants. the down side is it can be a bit noisy but this is barcelona and it is the ramblas. only probs with pick pockets here was at the train station when we were heading out to monserratt. breakfast is supplied but do not attempt to remove food as the kitchen police are vigilant which provides breakfast entertainment. photos to follow.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cymru99
Reviews.Content: 7 friends and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in february, after reading some of the reviews we were a little nervous. I can honestly say that we all thought the hotel was excellent. the location was brilliant in a very pretty square just off las ramblas. Our rooms were spotless and serviced everyday. we told reception as we left one morning that our toilet wasn't working and it was dealt with instantly. We found the receptionist very friendly and helpful. We didn't seem to notice any noise inside the hotel and any noise from outside was dealt with by closing the window. Breakfast was lovely and plentiful. We can't recommend this hotel highly enough considering we only paid £91 for 4 nights. Ignore all the bad reviews and give this hotel a go.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible !!!”
Reviews.Author: MiniVega
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with opodo.fr. My husband and I were in this hotel for 3 nights, and it was totally horrible! We were not able to sleep until 3:00 in the morning every night because of young people speaking, shouting, laughing in the corridors and in their rooms. In the closest room from us, some of them met together, spoke loud, listened to music. The walls are so thin that you feel like you're with them! I was totally upset about that point. It's an hotel not a youth hostel!! I don't understand why people can't respect the others! We spoke to the reception about this problem. Nothing was arranged. The reception staff was not very friendly, except a young man. The breakfast was nice, and the location is totally great. The rooms are simple, don't except too much! Anyway, Barcelona is a great city, for sure we will come back soon but not in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Natasha54
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed for last weekend in September. The location of the hotel is great just off las ramblas. The square it is in is very impressive and we were lucky enough to have a tiny balcony overlooking it all. The room was very basis but clean. The shower head was broke and we had to tie it up ourselves with the luggage belt. There was no remote control for the TV and no other way of changing channel, sound etc. We only made breakfast once but this was well worth having if you like croissants bread and jam and juices etc. For what you pay this hotel is a bargain due to it's fantastic location and the fact that breakfast is included. If we had been staying longer we would have reported the shower and TV but couldn't be bothered for the sake of a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible reception service”
Reviews.Author: minutemaidireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and it has its value for the money we paid. But I just couldnt believe how unfriendly the receptionist at night time was. He couldnt be bothered in saying good evening, and would make bad faces when you asked for the key to your room. He is the most disagreeable looking person Ive ever seen working in a reception. Even though, there was another guy during the day, he was really helpful and lovely, I could not understand the big difference between them. If you are going to this Hotel beware the OGRE at night time!

Reviews.Title: “If only...”
Reviews.Author: Cukka
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better, helpful staff, clean room&bathroom. The only thing that disturbed us was the shutting iron doors at night. These waked us few times almost every night. It was easier to handle the screaming students who were staying at the same floor. If I could be sure that those iron doors are thrown out, I would stay there every time I go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “i politely disagree with the bad reviews :-)”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter14
Reviews.Content: we just returned from four nights in barcelona at the hotel roma reial. this was our second time staying at this hotel, and it was just as lovely as our first trip two years ago! the room was clean (no ants in our room, and we definitely left lots of yummy spanish sweets and junk food open on the desk all night), the beds were comfy, and the pillows the best of our whole trip (and we slept on a loooot of pillows). the breakfast was every bit as simple and yummy as on our first trip as well ~ its that delicious espresso/coffee, pastries, and orange juice you would expect from a budget hotel. also, this was one of the most spacious hotels of our entire stay! the staff was friendly and helpful, and had our room ready ahead of time even though we were checking in at 8 in the morning. the location (Place Reial, off Las Ramblas) is great ~ you can walk to the beach, to Las Ramblas, to La Boqueria, and even uptown to all the great Gaudi stuff (like Casa Piedra, the Block of Discord, etc.) the only downside is the number of homeless people that seem to like to sleep and party in Placa Reial, but the weekend we were there a bizarre art exhibit took up all the space in the placa and temporarily kicked out all the homeless people. (i dont know if they've returned or not.) but hey ~ this is barcelona, this is a city, and homeless people just come with the territory, so to speak. i still recommend roma reial if this is your first trip to barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stellawindy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the center of Barcelona. Stayed here as a group of ladies in our forties and had great time. Big rooms, good breakfast and right in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: bluesimon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel the weekend 11th May - 14th May. I noticed this hotel had some bad reviews but the weekend i stayed was the grand prix and most places were booked up. This place is a gem. The rooms are average but the price and location were excellent. It cost £90 for 3 nights and is right in the centre of Barcelona in a beatiful plaza. It has a hotel bar next door which is good fun and is close to the subway and is 1 minute from las Ramblas and 5 minutes from the port. I would recommend this place to anyone who isn't expecting a 3*-5* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Low standard”
Reviews.Author: elaf
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly beacuse of the location, and OK reviews. I booked a double room in Hotel Comercio 5 months ago (Comercio + Reial are one company/owner). When we got to Comercio we were told they had some problems with some of the rooms so they allocated us in Reial. We got a room on 4th floor - 407 and I have to say it was rubbish. I read that Hong Kong hotels have small rooms - they are in fact quite good size; but the one in Roma Reial was really tiny! The bathroom was ok, but they could change that old and mouldy shower curtain. There was a window but with no view! Together with 2 other next door rooms, the windows were looking out to a square 'shaft', covered from the top by a piece of glass so we had no fresh air! And inside that 'shaft' on the walls there were all the drainage and pipes running so every time someone flushed their toilet.. imagine what we were forced to listen to. The room was dark and gloomy and because of a small window and that shaft - you don't even know what is the weather like - sunny? rainy? cloudy? You have to go outside to find out. I asked for another room but they were full... The hotel is very noisy - you can hear all the people talking in the next door rooms, you can hear high heels in the corridors, you can hear each door opening/shutting. If someone comes late to their next door room - you won't have a good night's sleep because they will for sure wake you up. Breakfast - I've had better... It's a continental style, but the 'marmalade' they serve is more of a 'juice soup' than a marmalade. I booked a room in Comercio hotel 5 months earlier and my credit card was charged then. All I got was this rubbish and no one even appologised for placing us in another hotel in a room with no view and fresh air. The staff is very indifferent to their guests - they don't smile, don't say much and do not really care. At least that was my impression. My advice: if you are staying there, ask for a room with a proper window and proper view. Remember that on each floor they have at least 5 rooms with a ‘shaft’ view... (there are two 'shafts' in the whole building) This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Not good standard.”
Reviews.Author: travellernorthants
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly for its location, which is great, but the hotel was just not up to standard. We had booked a double room, but what we received was a single with a large bed, only 1 set of towels, one glass in bathroom...no soap of any sort. The room was an inside one and totally airless and very claustrophobic, and the noise, not from outside but banging doors and load voices even at 5 am from inside the hotel. On asking at reception for more towels and glass there was a complete lack of interest and none was forthcoming. The staff generally made us feel we were really an inconvenience and were unhelpfull. I asked for an upgrade to a room with a window opening onto the square and with quite a bit of persuading this was done for the next nights stay for reasonable supplement. If this could not have been done I would have moved out, I could not have stayed another night in that room. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Despite the benefit of the location, we would not stay at the Roma Reial again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be put off by bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: ally_220
Reviews.Content: My friends and I also stayed in this hotel with the college from the 12th-15th March this year. After reading the reviews below, we felt like we had to make a contraction. Before the residentail, we all read the reviews of the hotel. This did disturb us at first and we were not looking forward to staying there. However, once we arrived, we realised that the reviews did not do any justice what-so-ever. The hotel was fairly basic but we found no problems with it and were pleasantly surprised. All rooms had a private bathroom and we were lucky enough to have a view of the square we were staying in. The food was always fresh with many options to choose from and eating in the breakfast room was delightful. Please do not be put off by the other reviews of this hotel. If you are looking for a cheap but cheerful hotel and are on a budget, this is perfect hotel for you. The location was great and within walking distance to the harbour, resturants, shops and bars.

Reviews.Title: “dont ever go”
Reviews.Author: xxxxxccccxxxx
Reviews.Content: this place is awful. i went to barelona with college for a residental in total there was 55 of us who stayed at the hotel.We went for 3 nights from the 12th marh -15th march 2007.when arriving at the hotel we find out only 3 of the rooms are ready.so we all take it in turns putting our luggage in 2 rooms and are told they will be done in 2 hours for about 2,but when we come bak rooms are still not ready.when we were finally allowed to go in our rooms,we were all told to chek our rooms,me and my two friends were staying on the 3rd floor ,the floor was very basic,walls were dirty,alot of dust our window in our room wouldn't even shut ,our bathroom window had 3 panels missing so people opposite could clearly see in .our tutors heked the room and were able to get us moved onto the 4th floor.this room wasn't much better except we had a good view of the square.the walls were even more dirty ,the shower didn't work properly and the mirror had big scrathes on.its very hard to get any sleep as outside is very loud.The breakfast is nothing speial. the whole place is basi,the staff are very rude and an't really speak any english .i won't be ever recommending this place

Reviews.Title: “College Residential”
Reviews.Author: beckski_89
Reviews.Content: on 12th march i stayed in the roma reial for 3 nights with a group of 51 students and teachers. problems occured from the start. we arrived at 11am and reception informed us that we couldnt check in till 2pm as the rooms were not ready, we had to leave all our luggage in 1 tiny room and go off wandering in our travelling gear, at 2pm we were told that our room would not be ready until 5pm!!! a total wasted and uncomfortable day! the staff are NOT friendly at all, they ignore you and do not understand english, rooms and beds were clean, many that slept 4 were cramped, hardly any floor or storage space, tv had no remote, but overall the rooms and bathrooms were in good condition, comfy beds and most of the showers work well. beware though, the walls are thin as this used to be a hostel, rooms are close to each other so the tiniest of nosies are heard by everyone, the lift is tiny and loud and if someone is talking in the lobby you can hear them 4 floors up!!! be prepared to climb loads of stairs, i counted 76 to our room on the 4th floor. i woke up to discover ants infesting my holdal and bed, covering the floor near the outside wall. i made a complaint to one of my teachers and by later that day there were no ants anywhere, i was impressed as had read really bad reviews of this hotel. if im honest you might aswell not bother with breakfast, over the 3 mornings i had a roll with butter, yogurts and orange juice. the bread is mainly stale and surprisingly there was no cheese or ham to accompany it, the cereal tastes of nothing and the crossiants were soggy and chewy. location of this hotel is excellent, bars, restaurant, pharmacies on the doorstep but so are the drunk, homeless and endless amounts of street dogs. a spa shop is close by which is cheap for water and snacks. the square does not quieten until around 4am and police are posted there all night until 7am but as we are students, early nights wernt needed. if you are not sure on what to eat the restaurant next door with outside seating is great and service is friendly, beware though, sitting outside leaves you open to the locals trying to sell you things and they dont take no for an answer. overall our stay was great, the location and what we did over rode the bad points and problems, the hotel was just a place to sleep for us, so less time there spent there the better.

Reviews.Title: “Pro's and Con's”
Reviews.Author: StudyAbroad07
Reviews.Content: After just having left Roma Reial, I'm a little torn about our experience there. Here's the deal: The staff are NOT overly friendly, but they do their jobs. The rooms are pretty spacious, and bathrooms are clean - we have HIGH STANDARDS and do not give that statement lightly. Linens were not changed during our 3 nights, but towels were fresh daily. An issue with those towels: we had three guests in our room, to discover there were only two towels. So the next night after our day in Barca, we asked the desk attendant on our way in for a third towel for the morning. He claimed he had no key, no access to any towels, and the cleaning staff would not arrive the next morning until AFTER we needed to leave on a day trip. He was unapologetic and insistent that he could do nothing to help us. The third morning we finally did have enough towels though... Breakfast we did not bother with because the LOCATION IS GREAT! That is the best part - you are steps away from the Liceau metro stop, a few gelato/pastry places, Cafe De L'Opera - great for coffee and choclate churros for breakfast, cheap - and the Boqueria Market. Definitely visit the market, its very authentic, cheap and very satisfying food! The Plaza Reial itself is lined with restaurants and bars, but the crowd is definitely rough. Police are posted there every night after dark, but due to cultural differences things that might be an issue in the States are overlooked - like homeless people, people pushing you to buy their junk or flowers, and a LOT of men making uncomfortable advances and suggestive noises. If you use common sense you are fine, but we enjoyed people-watching from the balcony MUCH more than actually sitting in the plaza. Be sure to get a balcony room. Don't let that info deter your stay because it really was okay, just be aware of the environment going into it. One last thing - while we were there for 3 nights, they somehow managed to open a "Hotel Roma Reial Restaurant" next door on the third night. Walking by it looked pretty upscale but small and bar-like, but we did not go in. Enjoy your stay in Barcelona - it was by FAR our favorite city in Spain!!!!! Pleasant Travels!

Reviews.Title: “gross room”
Reviews.Author: pitufala
Reviews.Content: This place was terrible for some reason in the web site it did not look so shabby, it wasnt cheap and it seemed like a rat hole. great location though..i am sure it wouldnt have been so bad if i had known it was very very very basic but i sort of expected more. i did not even want to lie in the bed. definately for budget travelers. young, and dont care were you lie! the tv had no volume control or remote control anyway. the breakfast was just stale bread and coffee. and the breakfast room had a cockroach one morning. yuck!!! i would never stay there again. definately will pay more even if it wasnt cheap in the first place

Reviews.Title: “all that you needed !”
Reviews.Author: x-xaimzx-x
Reviews.Content: I stopped at Roma Reial not long ago. Our skool had organised a trip to Barcelona and we stopped here. It was all that we needed and the rooms was clean. It was in an adorable location in a little square just off the main high street. The room me and the girls had was loacated on the top floor and was relitavley big with a nice big window overlooking the square. However my teachers rrom had no window and got very hot and clammy. I had a great stay in Barcelona and would retern there in the future. On particaully saturday and friday nights it does seem to get very load and earplugs would be reccomended. O verall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baleng1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two kids at the Roma Reial hotel recently and I found it nice; friendly and clean. The hotel is in Plaza Reial which is a stone's throw away from Las Ramblas (Barcelona's main road) and about 100 yards from a McDonald's (very useful if you have kids) and an Irish Pub (very useful if you don't have kids). The room was a bit small and basic but clean and the towels were changed every day. The breakfast was cold but not bad at all (corn flakes; croissants; juice; bread; butter; selection of jams and yoghurts; tea; coffee). Other residents were mainly young couples and families with kids. I would recommend the place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to worry about,Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sijjay
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Barcelona, (first time at the Roma Reial). Seemed very popular with budget travellers and School parties. ( Don't take that to be a negative). I can honestly say, that it was far better than some of the 3 star Hotels that i have stayed in ! The room was basic, (if slightly on the small side), but exceptionally clean, with a fully tiled bathroom and clean, comfortable beds. Can't comment on the breakfast as I never got there once. This is a no frills Hotel (you get what you pay for), yet I will certainly return and for what you pay, I would fully recommend it. Ideal central location for exploring down town Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “seriously don't even look at the bad reviews - completely misleading”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was completely panicing when i'd read all of the reviews. although there are good ones, the bad ones just overshadowed them completely, and i was really dreading the holiday. i was going with my college so i wasnt exactly expecting the most luxurious hotel but i was expecting more than what the reviews suggested the hotel was. it was actually the greatest holiday i've been on for years!the city is the most beautiful city i've ever been to and the hotel was situated in the best location in the whole city.we had a balcony and i spent hours in the middle of the night just sitting there watching the buzzing city with street entertainers.it was just off the ramblas so compared to hotels actually situated on it, it was quiet. yes it wasn't exactly the peak district quiet but hello!?!you're in Barcelona!!!what the hell are you doing sleeping.you're officially in the greatest city in the world!appreciate it whilst your there!if i wasn't with my college i would not be sleeping the whole week - and i'm a ten hour a night sorta girl - you can't get me out of bed normally!lol! i never ate the breakfasts in the morning as i'm not a breakfast sorta person bt all my friends did and they assured me it was fine. it's just the average continental breakfast with croissants, fresh bread and jam. we're just spoilt with our sausage bacon and egg :) the decor on the stairs, landing and bedrooms was bland but anything looks bland when your looking out of your balcony to a beautiful square partly created by such an important catalan architect as Gaudi who designed some of the most incredible buildings in the city. maybe i'm just biased because i fell in love with the city and had a fantastic holiday but i'll be returning to the roma reial every time (unless i become a millionaire and want to waste my money on a 5* hotel suite i'm never going to be in - save that for you're beach holiday - thats the only time i'm going to expect it now). the hotel staff were lovely. personally i was always greeted with a smile by the man at the reception and when we needed an essentual for our room, they ensured we had it. the cleaners came everyday - just a shame i had too many clothes and i'm the messiest most unorganised girl in the world so my stuf covered the bed but the rest of the girls had there beds made everyday. and the towels changed. oh yeah, everyone seems to be moaning about soap. well they've obviously listened to you prooving they do care about the guests abit.we had plenty of soap. i'm actually normally the fussiest person in the world and wouldnt dream of sleeping in a dump - i'm one of those annoying girlie girls you just want to slap for being so pathetic - i think the teachers were dreading taking me away but there was nothing for me to moan about. one of the teachers commented that she couldn't understand how it was only 1* and i completely agree.i've been to higher rated hotels in britain that have been bigger dumps. so this hotel is ideal for anyone who doesn't go to a fantastic city to sit in a hotel room all day but goes to a city to experience the atmosphere and vibrancy and who actually wants to be cultured.i promise you will not be located any better than the reial.it would be like being situated in the centre of covent garden in london.

Reviews.Title: “Student visit”
Reviews.Author: sandim2
Reviews.Content: We took a group of 16 & 17 year olds to Barcelona and were pleasantly surprised by the accomodation. Rooms were clean, actually looked they had been decorated recently and towels changed every day. Breakfast is basic, would suggest you might want to pop round to starbucks for coffee to take back as drinks were not good. We had rooms on the fourth floor which I would recomend as the hotel does get noisy at night because of al the student groups that are there.The Placa Reial is noisy at night especially if you want the windowopen so perhaps ear plugs for noise in and out of the hotel would be a good idea. All in all for a one star hotel definately above average.

Reviews.Title: “basic - good for what we needed it to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was okay however we had a lot of problems on arrival as the reception staff were very unorganised. They also spoke little english however once the initial problems were ironed out was not a problem. It was good as we were in a large school party and it was cheap and basic for what we needed and the location was not bad. I wouldnt have lasted a week in the place and was glad to be leaving after 3 days but all in all the hotel wasn't that bad at all. (I cannot comment on the breakfasts as our room was never up on time however I am assured there was a good selection!!)

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean and generally OK for younger travellers. Can be a bit noisy at night with some guests coming back from the night clubs. Breakfast was satisfactory. Staff were usually helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: KI15
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was extremely nervous about my choice of hotel for a family break. Having been to Barcelona before I chose the hotel for it's price and location. We initially had problems with heating, which were fixed immediately in one room, and were given a new room due to the second room being so cold. The rooms were clean, the staff very helpful. The standard of rooms does appear to be the luck of the draw, but we were pleased enough with ours. Yes, I did wake up with people comming back late, but I have stayed in far more expensive hotels in Barcelona before and encountered the same, (come on Barcelona is known as a major party city). Breakfast not really worth getting up for, and when they say it finishes at 10.00 they mean it finished at 10.00! However, there are plenty places to eat around you. With cheap flights with Easyjet, staying at this hotel allowed me to introduce Barcelona to my family for a grand total of £87-00 each for two nights, staying extremely centrally. Yes, it would not be my choice for summer months, but I would accept that I would want double glazing, air conditioning and have to pay accordingly. The break was a great success and the hotel more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the Roma Reial on a trip with college on 11th Nov until the 16th. After reading some of the reviews i wasn't really looking forward to staying in the hotel. Whilst staying at the hotel we only encountered 1 problem, which had nothing to do with the hotel itself just a pushy tutor from another college. The hotel is pretty basic but i found it to be clean and the staff were very helpful. The rooms were cleaned everyday. i didn't find there to be much noise at the hotel unless people had the patio doors open. But what can people expect anyway as the hotel is set in a busy square just off La Ramblas. All in all i throughely enjoyed my time at the Roma reial and would recommend it to travellers who are looking for a basic hotel in the heart of Barcelona.

HotelInfo.Name: Roma Reial Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza Reial 11, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
